comment: Took 4 week phys 1111 lab over the summer and so happy that I did. Only 10 graded assignments( 9 online labs + 10 question lab final). We were able to create a group of up to 4 people to work on each lab with which makes it much easier since each lab is about 3-4 parts to split up. Work at your own pace and submit by due dates.100% would take again

Graded by few things pretty much sums it up. He only had two quizzes, three homework quizzes, and three tests. Due to this, essentially it you screw up a test you are doomed, because there is almost no way to fill in the gap. He does have a lot of amazing recorded lectures, but I wouldn't take this prof again due to his grading style.
good physics lab!!
This was a hard class to take over the summer but the professor is great and explains the material very well. I would highly recommend this professor.

I took the 4 week class. The coursework is heavily condensed into those 4-weeks and must understand the concepts in 2/3 days or you will fall behind. The class is very doable and plenty of practice questions that prepare you for the exams. All your grades come from 3 exams that make up 85% of your grade, 15% from HW. Respondus w/ cam for exams.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: AMAZING, very understanding and flexible on due dates, easy grader, clear procedures for labs that made the report easy to complete. No quizzes. Take him!!!!
I had him for physics lab online, very easy class and easy grader which made this lab a breeze.

Overall, a really good professor. You cannot skip class though. It was only towards the end where he uploaded old lecture videos on D2L, so definitely go and take detailed notes. It's all math, nothing conceptual.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: McDaniel is amazing if you attend lecture. If you write down the problems he does in lecture and practice them you will do well on his exams. Also curves his exams (majority of the grade) and gives bonus points. BREAKOUT IS OPTIONAL. Expect a little arbitrary homework that doesn't reflect exam material but online materials can help you. GREAT PROF!

I'm bad at math and I was really scared going in, but he definitely made the class easier! One thing I like is that he doesn't bother with definitions or lectures, he just works through problems and tells you what's going to be on the tests. Attendance isn't mandatory but if you want to pass the class, I would attend anyway! Great prof, 10/10

Nice and funny guy who really enjoys teaching physics. He listens and can tell when people are confused and need further explanation. Works math problems in class and will post old recordings online for more practice if you ask. Go to lecture, breakout sessions, and do practice problems to do well. 85% of the grade is 2 exams and a final.

He doesn't post his notes online which can get quite annoying. Also, I really hate that your grade relies soooo heavily on the tests and quizzes and homework and you only get three chances. Three Test, quizzes, and homework are all your grades are relying on. I would 100 percent take a different teacher.

He's EXCELLENT. I struggle with math, I was so scared going in but I stg he made it enjoyable, every lecture is almost always full even tho attendance isnt mandatory, bc they're just good. He doesnt waste time with powerpoints or lecturing, he just works through problems and makes it easy. I wish he was teaching phys II bc he's just god tier
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: One of the easiest professors Ive taken. Labs are quick and straight to the point. I ended up with a 99% in the class. You get to work in a group too, which made the work so much easier. Easy A

I loved the lectures, as it was a fun environment, but you really only have 3 grades: the 3 exams that make up 80% of the grade. They are challenging too. Once you get the hang of what McDaniel expects though, you can scrape by and come out good. Just put in the work.

The class was 50 mins long which made it very hard to learn the material which isn't his fault. However, he did get off track a lot. 3 hw, 2 tests, and 1 final. He will only give you practice problems in class and in breakout session. STUDY THEM! The class was hard and you will need to put in effort. I personally would recommend another professor.

If you show up to class you can get an A. This class was super easy. You work in groups and turn in one report together. The labs were easy, short, and we rarely stayed even close to the full class time. If you're looking for an easy class take this professor.

Prof. McDaniel is super easy-going in lab. He gives an informative pre-lab lecture, detailing any formulas we need and any conceptual drawings to help us better understand. He helps us out immensely and checks on us every 10 minutes. Every lab grade has been a 100. There's a dropped lab and lab is done in groups of 4. No final. Take him!

Physics is a difficult class, but Prof. McDaniel tries to make it easy. Lot of homework, 2 tests and a final. Physics is a science that requires a lot of practice and that is what he tries to do both in class and in breakout sessions. It is important to make sure that you do the practice and you should be fine
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Professor McDaniel was a funny enough guy but he should really not be teaching a beginner physics class. Grades are based on 3 homework assignments, 3 tests, and a final. He doesn't post any practice problems, so you better show up to every class. Makes you work HARD for the grade. I ate, dreamed, and lived physics during this class to get an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: If you do not like physics AVOID THIS MAN AT ALL COSTS! He takes physics to a whole different level that is extremely difficult to the point you're doing more than what's really needed vs other physic professors will teach the same lesson at a much simpler pace and make it a lot easier when it comes to tests. Whole class fails  He blames the class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: There's not really a pre-lab lecture, he just literally gives you all of the answers. You just need to do the lab to get the numbers to plug in. Easiest lab I've taken. Show up an get a 100.

Prof McDaniel is a fine teacher. Does practice problems in class, no theory or concepts. Very hard A, but can be done. Very time consuming (3+ hrs of lectures per day). 4 week is fast but rewarding. TESTS DO NOT REFLECT LECTURES. You must be able to put problems together on your own. Curved the first exam only (5 pts). I recommend the 8wk version.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I took the 4 week class. He's a nice professor and answers questions thoroughly, but this is very test heavy without notes (only multiple choice, so no partial/extra credit opportunities). This class is not for everyone and I struggled a lot. I don't recommend having a lot of other commitments with this class. The lectures are pretty long too.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Cool dude but gets an attitude if you ask something he thinks you should know the answer to. Grading is based on very few things and very heavy on tests. He gives no extra credit.

I had him for both 2211 and 2212 Lab and he was great for both. Physics really isn't my thing, but I learned more in his lab than the actual lecture. As long as you follow his directions and listen to his pre lab you will get an A. He will even tell you that. He makes sure you understand things during the lab which is nice. Take him for both labs!

I had him for lab and he explains everything very well. He even goes around making sure everyone knows what they're doing, unlike previous professors I've had. Pretty great professor and I would have probably signed up for his physics lecture class if I had known.

Ok, so I only got a B because I was dummy lazy but this guy is amazing. He will help you and his tests are fair. Don't get caught lacking by the homework and you should be straight swimming for an A in this class. Also, toes. You don't understand now, but you will.

Had him for physics II lab. Really great choice for lab. Requires only one person per group to turn in a lab report. He engages with students during lab and makes sure you understand what you are doing. Labs are easy and if you actually do them, you should get an A. One work of advice though, never be late to lab, he hates it when people are late.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: Brent McDaniel is a great professor. His class is difficult, but it is manageable. If you naturally understand physics, then you should totally be fine for his class. Make sure you come to class everyday, because his exams are taken from examples in lecture. Complete the homework, but don't focus too much on it. Good luck!

Took him for a 4 week summer course. Two 10 question multiple choice exams and final. 1 problem quiz before each exam that comes directly from the problems he assigns from textbook. Allowed us to work the problems at home and use them during the quizzes. Test are difficult but study problems from notes and homework problems and you will do fine.

Took during summer so class was fast but he took the time to answer questions to make sure people understood. Short exams, like the examples worked in class. Very helpful and kind. - Also had him for lab and he made it easy to understand and helped along the way to make sure students weren't just going through confused or doing it wrong.

Funny dude and down to earth. Wants you to do well. He kind of tries to act cool and be like a college student and fit in with us. Only thing about him is he does have a big of an anger problem at times if you don't understand something and he has to explain to you more than once. But other than that, a good professor, i would take him again.

It's Physics II so the class is difficult, but he tells you which concepts will be on the test in lecture. He gives you all the info you need to pass the tests. Also the final is worth 30% but he gives you a study guide with 40 questions and 15 of them are the exact questions on the final.

I loved Dr. McDaniel! He taught very well for a hard class like phys 2 and he has jokes. Class consisted of 2 tests, 3 webassigns, 3 "pop quizzes", and a final. Tests and grading were fair. GO TO CLASS AND BREAKOUT b/c chances are he'll go over test matierals by working problems.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: The labs are done in groups so each group turns in 1 lab report. Easy grader and explains labs very well.

McDaniel is one of the best professors I have ever had! Physics II is a hard class, but he explains everything is a way that makes it make so much sense! Also he's hilarious, he really made the class fun. Gives 10 bonus points on your lowest test grade and another 10 points on the final if you do this pretest that doesn't count against you.

Loved this professor's class. For how difficult this material was, he made everything as fair as possible in terms of what to study for to prepare for the tests as well as the difficulty of the overall class/tests. Best of all he had a very effective teaching style. Would highly recommend!

He's super funny which was pretty important for a 9am. His lectures consist of him doing examples on the board and nothing else. WRITE THOSE PROBLEMS DOWN. They (and the recitation q's) are what you need to study. If you can get those problems down, you're solid. It took me a while to figure that out. Also his final was really easy. 10/10.

Professor McDaniel is really a one of a kind science professor. He goes through examples so thoroughly and clearly, and he tells you what he's looking for on the test (so if you understand the questions in lecture/homework, you will be set). He's also really funny and a very helpful instructor in and out of class. KSU got lucky tbh.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Brent is a really intelligent guy who definitely has a passion for Physics. His class is tough, but its physics, what do you expect? If you attend class, do the homework problems, and pay attention you'll be fine. The problems on the exams come directly from problems worked in class, or in the homework. Go to class and put in effort, you'll do fine

Honestly one of the best professor!! 3 homework assignments and few test. his test is really easy 10 questions if you pay attention in class he literally tells you during the lecture which question will be on the test. EVEN FINAL IS VERY EASY! U WILL STILL MAKE AN A+ EVEN THOUGH IF YOU ARE NOT A MATH PERSON! I WOULD SAY TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!

Took him for the 4 week physics I summer session. Great teacher, very smart, a little rude at some points but if you can get past that, you'll have a really good experience in physics. Spends most of class going over problems exactly like the test. If you pay attention in class and understand the homework (which aren't for a grade) you'll do great!

The problems from recitation and lecture are almost word for word the questions on the exams. Understand how to get from the question to the set up and you're golden. There's isn't wiggle room for a bad test grade, so reach out if you're confused.

Honestly this is a really difficult class, but Dr. Mcdaniel makes it fun. 3 homeworks for the whole year about 30 questions each. Tests were 10 multiple choice. Questions come from recitation and lectures. He will tell you what will be on the test if you listen. Definitely would take again. He will make you laugh.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: First time I ever took physics and it had to the calc based course lol.  Dr. McDaniel is straightforward and don't throw in the towel after the first test.  I failed two out of the three tests miserably, like 30 and 40, and still clutched the final for dat 70 boi!  Book is useless and homework is ruff.

I took Professor McDaniel and went to class barely at all outside of test days and finished with a B+. Easy professor who provides a ton of extra credit (for example, 15+ on test 1, 25+ on test 2). Final was copied straight from the study guide, and he told us beforehand that it would be. I honestly should have made an A but I was lazy. Take him!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Mixed feelings here. Mcdaniel is a good person and tries to help his students, but teaching method is not very effective.  Book will only confuse you unless you really understand the material when relating it to the class work.  Problems from class/recitation show up on tests and wiley for hw.  3 tests ( 2 essay and 5-6 MC) which can be curved.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: If anyone rates Dr. McDaniel badly then its obvious that he/she did not put enough effort in the course. Absolutely amazing professor and without a doubt the best professor I have ever had. He's always there to help and everything he explains and all the problems he does in class and in recitation will show up on tests. Take notes, Study, Pass

Before registering for the class, I was concerned by all of the negative reviews this professor had, but now, I honestly don't understand all of the criticism. While this class (Summer 4 weeks) was fast paced, I found no problem keeping up. His tests are 10 MC questions, but it is straight forward and fair. This class was what I expected it to be.

Brent is a one of a kind teacher. He is hilarious and doesn't really care what he says. In my opinion this makes him really cool. He also knows his course very well and is willing to stay after class to answer questions. The tests are multiple choice and only 10 questions each. Study the problems from class and recitation and you will do fine.

I wouldn't recommend taking the four week course with  him over the summer unless you are really  dedicated to studying. I was intimidated by the class when he would insult students for asking questions. Before the final exam I was failing miserably. It took  work, dedication, and sleep deprivation  to pull off a decent grade on the final & course.

seems like a nice guy, and if you are talking to him about random stuff then he is. But once people started asking questions in class he became very condescending. He even started yelling a couple times. He would get upset because people stopped asking questions but every time somebody did he insults them. VERY RUDE. He thinks he is the coolest.

I was terrified to take physics, but Dr. McDaniel actually made it my favorite class. I'm not a science major, but I got an A (with hard work!!!). He's a great lecturer and will always take time to explain problems a second time if students are unclear. Also, labs are easy and he will take time during labs to help you individually with anything!

I don't know what everyone else is complaining about. Yes, the class is hard, and we don't really use the book except for optional homework, but it's college physics. The key is to keep up with the notes, work out the problems in class by yourself instead of following blindly, and go to the SI sessions. Just make sure you know some basic algebra.

Great professor, makes class fun. Very fast-paced when working out problems but if you have questions he will stop and break things down for you. Homework isn't mandatory but helpful- still better to work out his in-class examples (which are harder) to prepare for his exams. Didn't find the class nearly as difficult as I thought but still not easy

Ugh..this professor. Don't bother buying the book, the formulas and techniques he teaches in class are not in book. U must derive formulas for yourself during exam. If you do not get it in class, you won't get it at all. He uses variables which are not in the book, so it's extremely difficult to understand the material. Demeans you when u ask ques.

I have never in my life had such mixed feelings about a professor. I loved him because he was easy to understand and in class exampled were easy to follow. I hated him because his exams seemed so much more different from in class exampled and hw. I went to his office to tell him my concerns and he was so understanding and nice.

Took his phys 1 course at KSU, got a C. Took phys 2 (allegedly a harder class) at Georgia State, got an A-; not only that, actually understood the material better. Teacher makes a big difference. He's very useful during lab sessions and is willing to answer questions, but he expects a ton out of his students. Teaches at a rapid pace. GOOD LUCK.

The tests are extremely hard, BUT, that's the nature of the class, meaning the material is difficult to understand. The professor is VERY helpful and willing to answer any and all questions you might have. He will definitely prepare you for 2212.

I transfer out of KSU a couple years ago, and recently graduated with a Chemical Engr Degree from Virginia Tech (No bull). McDaniel was the most mediocre teacher I had at KSU, not bc of knowledge but attitude and lack of teaching skills. So do yourself a favor and take this class at another college...I recommend Whitenton at SPSU

Dont let him intimidate you. He is actually a really nice guy that wants you to succeed in a very hard class. Work ahead and do all hw problems.   Take advantage of time after lab to ask questions. Be prepared to spend a lot of time on this class.

This is the higher level of physics, he is willing to work with you if you've never taken physics before. Do the quizzes and labs seriously, but the final exam is still heavily weighted, so don't one-side your efforts. Just work hard and he is there to help in person and email response it good. He is a good teacher, very knowledgeable in this subje

physics is a hard class so  whatever professor you take it will not be a walk in the park. he is willing to help you with anything you need during the leftover lab time. multiple application use in his tests. weekly quizes&lab give your grade a boost at the end so take those seriously! 1st test average was 45, his highest ever for the first!

So, he's hard. Get over it. He doesn't like for people to fail his class-and it shows when he talks about his tests-this class is just historically hard. He is trying to adjust the way tests are taken this semester to make people get higher grades. He is fair, and tries to make sure that you understand the material. Study study study for all tests
I didn't notice as many of the issues as everyone else, but I don't disagree either. I would take him again, but be prepared to study. At least he's not awful to look at ;)

I really liked this class and learned a great deal. His tests are very hard, you need to read the book and study a great deal (no sutdy guide). He was very helpful and always took questions. He does not grade labs but they are on the tests. This was one of the most challengeing classes that I have taken, but I learned a lot.
Worst Professor I have had in my entire career, He got me behind my life for a long time by making me drop the class.  AVOID TAKING HIM,, AVIOD, HE WILL FRY YOU LIKE FRENCH FRIES.

The absolute worst professor I've had so far. He understands the material with ease so his expectations are EXTREMELY high. If you don't have a masters in physics, don't expect higher than a C. He actually cussed out several students for asking questions, refused to correct improper grading, and tests at a level FAR above what he teaches in class.
his tests are very hard. You need to do all your homework and look at tests from previous classes to pass his tests. does not check labs...you just need to put your name on them.

The guy may known his stuff but thats only half a teachers job.Convey information to students in a clear and understanding method is the other more important half. McD does NOT do this. And then there's the attitude b/c he finds himself in the UNIQUE position of teaching a hard class.worst prof ever

He was pretty much useless regardles of where he got his degree from, or how many years of experience he has (according to him). He?s lazy, moody, rushed thr the material. I kid you not I worked harder than ever. Best Decision I made was 2 withdraw the class. Funny thing, I retook it at SPSU as a transfer got an A end of story. Hope my review helps

Physics is a hard class. Get over it. McDaniel is a Tech grad and it shows. He is a very clear teacher who knows what he is talking about and presents the material well. Don't walk into this class expecting an easy grade. Tests are extremely difficult and really makes sure you are grasping the material. Lab grade is an easy grade and a savior.

Ladies and Gentlemen, Please do not take this guy if you like to move forward in your life. HE is super incompetent, No experience, Too moody, and he thinks he is the Sh---. I believe he has no intellegence to understand that poeple have a life and cant devote to physic 24/7. Again, Do not Take him unless you are tired of living.

He is an intelligent, clear professor.He is a GA Tech graduate;he worked there for about 18 years.Still, some people say he has no experience!This is unbelievable.PHYS 2211 and 2212 is a historically difficult course.Students find it hard almost always. Many people came to his class w/o ever taking phys and expect an A!Ridic!He is a superb teacher!

This guy has an attitude problem, he thinks he knows it all. He is not good in helping people to understand the material, people just don't seem to understand him. Bottom line is this: if you never had physics before, avoid like the plague, if you're good at it, take him (maybe).
The 2 people who wrote their reviews before me are right, this guys sucks. You just can't understand him. Avoid. Previous to taking this class I had all A's but the D that he gave me killed my GPA.

This guy blows things out of proportion, making physics an extremely hard subject(harder than it already is). Avoid, I'm not joking here. After the first test there were some people with tears on their eyes, and he doesn't care if you win or if you lose. Hey McDaniels, do the world a favor and retire from being a teacher for life.

Due to his lack of experience and personality Dr. McDaniels is without a doubt a mediocre proffessor with an extremely high withdraw and failure rate. Would never recomend to anyone. Make no mistake, if you end up in his class, this skinny guy who likes to show up in class wearing flip flops WILL BREAK YOU.
